intro: Gethyllis lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf starburry, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling stars. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Gethyllis lanceolata is a perennial herb that is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate and attractive blooms.
